an10.2:4.1: “Mendicants, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethical conduct, need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.3: It’s only natural that an ethical person has no regrets.
an10.2:4.4: When you have no regrets you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.6: It’s only natural that gladness springs up when you have no regrets.
an10.2:4.7: When you feel glad you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.9: It’s only natural that rapture arises when you’re glad.
an10.2:4.10: When your mind is full of rapture you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.12: It’s only natural that your body becomes tranquil when your mind is full of rapture.
an10.2:4.13: When your body is tranquil you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.15: It’s only natural to feel bliss when your body is tranquil.
an10.2:4.16: When you feel bliss you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.17: ‘May my mind be unified in samādhi!’
an10.2:4.18: It’s only natural for the mind to be unified in samādhi when you feel bliss.
an10.2:4.19: When your mind is unified in samādhi you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.21: It’s only natural to truly know and see when your mind is unified in samādhi.
an10.2:4.22: When you truly know and see you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.24: It’s only natural to become disillusioned and dispassionate when you truly know and see.
an10.2:4.25: When you’re disillusioned and dispassionate you need not make a wish:
an10.2:4.26: ‘May I realize the knowledge and vision of freedom!’
an10.2:4.27: It’s only natural to realize the knowledge and vision of freedom when you’re disillusioned and dispassionate.
an10.2:5.1: And so, mendicants, the knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.2:5.2: Disillusionment and dispassion is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing.
an10.2:5.3: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of samādhi.
an10.2:5.4: Samādhi is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
an10.2:5.5: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquillity.
an10.2:5.6: Tranquillity is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
an10.2:5.7: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of gladness.
an10.2:5.8: Gladness is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
an10.2:5.9: Not having regrets is the purpose and benefit of wholesome ethics.
an10.2:5.10: And so, mendicants, good qualities flow on and fill up from one to the other, for going from the near shore to the far shore.”
